content:
Winchester College offers an academically rigorous and diverse curriculum for its students. Here's an overview of the academic curriculum at Winchester College:

Lower School (ages 13-14):
Winchester College's Lower School curriculum is centered around the core subjects of English, Maths, Science, and Foreign Languages. Students also study Humanities which includes History, Geography, and Religious Studies. In addition to these subjects, students take courses in Art, Music, and Drama.

Middle School (ages 14-16):
In the Middle School, students study for their IGCSE exams, which are externally examined qualifications in a range of subjects. The IGCSEs are equivalent to GCSEs and cover a breadth of academic disciplines including Maths, Sciences, English Literature, English Language, and Humanities. Students are required to take a minimum of nine IGCSEs, but most will take ten or eleven. 

Sixth Form (ages 16-18):
Students in the Sixth Form study for their A-levels, which are externally examined qualifications that prepare them for university study. A-levels are studied in-depth, in three or four subjects, and require students to develop advanced analytical and critical thinking skills.
 
Overall, Winchester College's academic curriculum is designed to challenge and inspire students to achieve their potential in a range of academic disciplines. The school believes in enabling students to develop a deep understanding of each subject, nurturing intellectual curiosity, and instilling lifelong learning habits.
